file_content.text: The councillor should make his diplomatic mission thanks to you.
I've been following your progress. The councillor is safe and sound for now. Once the coast is clear, I'll take a team for exfiltration.
The Senate needs to hear firsthand what happened to Corellia's government; we'll make sure the councillor can tell them.
Fine work. All of you. The Republic couldn't ask for better defenders.
This is what they're talking about when they call you the guardians of the Republic.
I'm sure a pat on the back won't compare to all your commendations, but thanks, soldier.
You really are the best at making a great escape. You ever want to earn an easy living passing on those skills, the service could use you.
This is why I'm here.
Don't mention it.
Stay safe out there.
Whatever.
All right, all right, didn't mean to waste your precious time.
Go, get him before the Imperials do.
Master Jedi, I hope you're here for the fight, 'cause I need you.
Soldier! Havoc Squad, right? You're just what I need right now.
Hold up, hold up. I thought it was you. Can't imagine what's got you running around down here, but I need someone who's good under pressure.
Your friends, too, if they're willing.
Name's Halloway, SIS observer, analyst, and right now, helpless bystander.
I'm here for you.
My field days are long passed. All I've got left to lend to the cause is experience. Right now, I need a strong arm.
One of the last pro-Republic councillors was on a transport headed offworld; the Imperials shot it down over hostile territory.
The tracking device on the councillor indicated that he survived the crash, but it failed shortly after.
Count on my rescue.
The Imps have already started moving on the crash site; you'll need to hurry to have any chance of finding him first.
At best, it's an equipment failure. At worst... Imperial grunts are already sweeping the crash site, so you get the idea.
This is the location of the crash site and an old resistance hideout nearby. I'll be watching.
Tough break. [Refuse quest]
I haven't got time to convince you. Come back when you're willing to pitch in.
Where's the crash--can you confirm survivors? What? Look, I've got a situation.
Why do you need help?
Get to the point.
Get to the point.
Uh-oh.
